metadata.Title: CVE-2017-18204 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The ocfs2_setattr function in fs/ocfs2/file.c in the Linux kernel before 4.14.2 allows local users to cause a denial of service (deadlock) via DIO requests. It was discovered that a race condition existed in the OCFS2 file system implementation in the Linux kernel. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (kernel deadlock).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-18204` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:
